accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Captain, United States Army; commanding officer, Motor Transportation Corps Supply Depot No. 702, 1918-1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Diary, correspondence, clippings, and photographs, relating to activities of Motor Transportation Corps Supply Depot No. 702 in Paris during World War I.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Motor Transport Corps.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918--Transportation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes newspaper clippings of the Paris peace negotiations and pictures of the Motor Transportation Corps.

did.unittitle: "Picture and Pen Story of a Lieutenant in the A.E.F." notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This notebook incudes photos of the Allied Armistice Commission of which Capt. Knight was a member and pictures of General Pershing inspecting the Motor Transportation Corps Supply Depot No. 702 (responsible for the Paris Sector).

did.unittitle: Photo album of the Motor Transportation Depot No. 702 in a loose leaf binder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Capt. Knight was the Commanding Officer of this unit, and participated in the battles of Meuse-Argonne, Marne and Bellean Wood.

did.unittitle: Photo album of World War I scenes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes pictures of operations of the Motor Transportation Corps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A book published in 1898 shows the destruction of the Marne and pictures of contemporary units of the U.S. Navy.
